title: Margot Robbie
content:
{{Short description|Australian actress and producer (born 1990)}} {{pp-blp|small=yes}} {{Use Australian English|date=April 2021}} {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2022}} {{Infobox person | name = Margot Robbie | image = Margot Robbie Vogue Barbie 2023 03.jpg | caption = Robbie in 2023 | birth_name = Margot Elise Robbie | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1990|7|2}} | birth_place = [[Dalby, Queensland]], Australia | education = [[Somerset College]] | occupation = {{hlist|Actress|producer}} | years_active = 2008–present | works = [[Margot Robbie filmography|Full list]] | organization = [[LuckyChap Entertainment]] | spouse = {{marriage|[[Tom Ackerley]]|2016}} | awards = [[List of awards and nominations received by Margot Robbie|Full list]] | signature = }} '''Margot Elise Robbie''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|m|ɑːr|ɡ|oʊ|_|ˈ|r|ɒ|b|i}} {{respell|MAR|goh|_|ROB|ee}}; born 2 July 1990) is an Australian actress and producer. [[Margot Robbie filmography|Her work]] includes both [[Blockbuster (entertainment)|blockbuster]] and [[independent film]]s, and [[List of awards and nominations received by Margot Robbie|her accolades]] include nominations for three [[Academy Awards]], six [[British Academy Film Awards|BAFTA Awards]] and four [[Golden Globe Awards]]. ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' named her one of the [[Time 100|100 most influential people in the world]] in 2017, and ''[[Forbes]]'' named her the [[List of highest-paid film actors|world's highest-paid actress]] in 2023. Born and raised in [[Queensland]], Robbie began her career in 2008 on the television series ''[[Neighbours]]'', on which she was a regular until 2011. After moving to the United States, she led the television series ''[[Pan Am (TV series)|Pan Am]]'' (2011–2012) and had her breakthrough in 2013 with [[Martin Scorsese]]’s comedy film ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]''. She achieved wider recognition with starring roles as [[Jane Porter (Tarzan)|Jane Porter]] in ''[[The Legend of Tarzan (film)|The Legend of Tarzan]]'' (2016), and as [[Harley Quinn (DC Extended Universe)|Harley Quinn]] in the [[DC Extended Universe]] films beginning with ''[[Suicide Squad (2016 film)|Suicide Squad]]'' (2016). Robbie received critical acclaim and a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Actress]] for her portrayal of figure skater [[Tonya Harding]] in the biopic ''[[I, Tonya]]'' (2017). This acclaim continued for her performances as [[Queen Elizabeth I]] in ''[[Mary Queen of Scots (2018 film)|Mary Queen of Scots]]'' (2018), [[Sharon Tate]] in ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]'' (2019), and a [[Fox News]] employee in ''[[Bombshell (2019 film)|Bombshell]]'' (2019). The last of these earned her a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress]]. Robbie has since starred as an aspiring actress in the period film ''[[Babylon (2022 film)|Babylon]]'' (2022) and the fashion doll [[Barbie]] in the comedy ''[[Barbie (film)|Barbie]]'' (2023), which emerged as her highest-grossing release and, as its producer, earned her a nomination for the [[Academy Award for Best Picture]]. Robbie and her husband, filmmaker [[Tom Ackerley]], co-founded the production company [[LuckyChap Entertainment]] in 2014, under which they have produced several films, including ''I, Tonya'', ''[[Promising Young Woman]]'' (2020), ''Barbie'', and ''[[Saltburn (film)|Saltburn]]'' (2023), as well as the [[Hulu]] series ''[[Dollface]]'' (2019–2022) and the [[Netflix]] miniseries ''[[Maid (miniseries)|Maid]]'' (2021). ==Early life and education== Margot Elise Robbie was born on 2 July 1990 in [[Dalby, Queensland]], to Doug Robbie, a former farm-owner and [[sugarcane]] [[Business magnate|tycoon]], and Sarie Kessler, a [[Physical therapy|physiotherapist]].{{cite magazine|url=http://www.harpersbazaar.co.uk/fashion/fashion-news/margot-robbie-april-issue-cover|title=Margot Robbie is Bazaar's April cover star|last=Bilmes|first=Alex|date=1 March 2015|magazine=[[Harper's Bazaar]]|access-date=16 April 2015|archive-date=11 August 2015|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150811220341/http://www.harpersbazaar.co.uk/fashion/fashion-news/margot-robbie-april-issue-cover}}{{cite news|url=https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/we-can-prove-margot-robbie-isnt-lying-about-her-age_us_573617dfe4b060aa781a3de5|title=We Can Prove Margot Robbie Isn't Lying About Her Age|last=Marcus|first=Stephanie|date=13 May 2016|work=[[HuffPost]]|access-date=14 May 2016|archive-date=14 May 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160514112251/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/we-can-prove-margot-robbie-isnt-lying-about-her-age_us_573617dfe4b060aa781a3de5|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=https://au.lifestyle.yahoo.com/margot-robbie-s-sugarcane-tycoon-dad-doug-robbie-32346322.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLnNlLw&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAGqPl7M0gaR-dYemDCuWXLqUcLZMoYeqUMB0Iy9uL4hYEHXH4eFoRrquOZ1eBoYHwVugvsaz9mdJFnoGjsxJBLQYMAxB2_mX4N-OpdjSxGpLgBP7K0EwGR4e5HUFWDhHYQFp2FbVIMM_agqsWgnsHKLWnTvjX_rH1jOgS4-l5qY1|title=Revealed! Why Margot Robbie disowned her sugarcane tycoon dad|work=[[Yahoo!]]|first=Jennifer|last=Fletcher|date=15 August 2016|accessdate=18 April 2021|archive-date=18 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210418122735/https://au.lifestyle.yahoo.com/margot-robbie-s-sugarcane-tycoon-dad-doug-robbie-32346322.html?guccounter=1&guce_referrer=aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cuZ29vZ2xlLnNlLw&guce_referrer_sig=AQAAAGqPl7M0gaR-dYemDCuWXLqUcLZMoYeqUMB0Iy9uL4hYEHXH4eFoRrquOZ1eBoYHwVugvsaz9mdJFnoGjsxJBLQYMAxB2_mX4N-OpdjSxGpLgBP7K0EwGR4e5HUFWDhHYQFp2FbVIMM_agqsWgnsHKLWnTvjX_rH1jOgS4-l5qY1|url-status=live}} She is the second youngest of four; older siblings Anya and Lachlan and younger brother Cameron.{{cite news|url=http://www.newidea.com.au/article/celebrityroyals/margot-robbie-s-sad-family-secret |title=Margot Robbie's Sad Family Secret |date=15 August 2016 |work=New Idea |location=Australia |access-date=19 December 2016 |archive-date=23 November 2016 |archive-url=https://archive.today/20161123125154/http://www.newidea.com.au/article/celebrityroyals/margot-robbie-s-sad-family-secret |url-status=live}} Additional on 19 December 2016.{{cite web|url=http://www.margotrobbie.com.au/margot-robbie-interviews/exclusive-interview-with-margot/|title=Exclusive Interview with Margot |publisher=Gold Coast (Australia) via Margot Robbie official website| date=26 January 2014|access-date=6 July 2015| archive-date= 3 March 2016 | archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20160303235929/http://www.margotrobbie.com.au/margot-robbie-interviews/exclusive-interview-with-margot/ | url-status=live}} Her parents separated when she was five.{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/margot-robbie-cover-july-2019|title=Margot Robbie on Quentin Tarantino, Marriage, and the One Word She Hates Being Called|magazine=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|first=Irina|last=Aleksander|date=6 June 2019|access-date=5 April 2021|archive-date=11 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210411120252/https://www.vogue.com/article/margot-robbie-cover-july-2019|url-status=live}} Robbie and her siblings were raised by their single mother and had minimal contact with their father. The family spent the majority of Robbie's upbringing on her grandparents' [[Currumbin Valley, Queensland|Currumbin Valley]] farm{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/actress-margot-robbie-beauty-tricks-suicide-squad-calvin-klein-deep-euphoria-perfume-pilates-surfing|title=Margot Robbie Belonged to a Surfer Girl Gang—And More Confessions From the Aussie Bombshell|work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|date=17 September 2016|accessdate=22 January 2023|archive-date=29 January 2023|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230129102252/https://www.vogue.com/article/actress-margot-robbie-beauty-tricks-suicide-squad-calvin-klein-deep-euphoria-perfume-pilates-surfing|url-status=live}} in the [[Gold Coast hinterland]].{{Cite news|url=http://www.goldcoastbulletin.com.au/entertainment/homegrown-hollywood-starlet-margot-robbie-home-on-the-gold-coast-for-christmas/news-story/cfbbb91a68cb1f795b8c4bcbcefcac6c|title=Homegrown Hollywood starlet Margot Robbie home on the Gold Coast for Christmas|last=Houghton|first=Jack|date=14 December 2014|work=[[Gold Coast Bulletin]]|access-date=29 June 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20161223131441/http://www.goldcoastbulletin.com.au/entertainment/homegrown-hollywood-starlet-margot-robbie-home-on-the-gold-coast-for-christmas/news-story/cfbbb91a68cb1f795b8c4bcbcefcac6c|archive-date=23 December 2016|url-status=dead}}
{{cite web|title=Margot Robbie Interview|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KjICBHj1EzM|via=[[YouTube]]|publisher=[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]|access-date=11 December 2017|archive-date=11 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171211043725/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KjICBHj1EzM|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theresident.co.uk/london-culture-events/margot-robbie-on-life-in-clapham-her-new-film-i-tonya/|title=Margot Robbie on Life in Clapham & Her New Film 'I, Tonya'|work=The Resident|first=Karen Anne|last=Overton|date=5 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180130110304/https://www.theresident.co.uk/london-culture-events/margot-robbie-on-life-in-clapham-her-new-film-i-tonya/|archive-date=30 January 2018|accessdate=18 April 2021|url-status=dead}} An energetic child, Robbie often put on shows in her house.{{cite web|url=https://togethermag.eu/margot-robbie-a-hollywood-actress-living-the-dream/|title=Margot Robbie: A Hollywood actress living the dream|work=[[Together (union)|Together]]|date=1 June 2018|accessdate=18 April 2021|archive-date=18 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210418122736/https://togethermag.eu/margot-robbie-a-hollywood-actress-living-the-dream/|url-status=live}} She was enrolled in a [[circus school]] by her mother, where she excelled in [[trapeze]], in which she received a certificate at age eight.{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/margot-robbie-june-cover-wolf-of-wall-street-jane-legend-of-tarzan|title=Tarzan's Margot Robbie on Why She's No Damsel in Distress|work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|first=Jonathan|last=Van Meter|date=13 May 2016|accessdate=18 April 2021|archive-date=21 August 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160821170730/http://www.vogue.com/13435036/margot-robbie-june-cover-wolf-of-wall-street-jane-legend-of-tarzan|url-status=live}} In high school, Robbie studied drama at [[Somerset College]].{{cite magazine |url=http://www.harpersbazaar.co.uk/fashion/fashion-news/margot-robbie-april-issue-cover |title=Margot Robbie is Bazaar's April cover star|last=Bilmes|first=Alex|date=1 March 2015|magazine=[[Harper's Bazaar]]|access-date=16 April 2015 | archive-date= 11 August 2015 |url-status=live | archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20150811220341/http://www.harpersbazaar.co.uk/fashion/fashion-news/margot-robbie-april-issue-cover}} As a teenager, she worked three jobs: she tended a bar, cleaned houses, and worked at [[Subway (restaurant)|Subway]].{{cite news|url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/annehelenpetersen/margot-robbie-birds-of-prey-harley-quinn-career-producer|title=How Margot Robbie Changed Her Hollywood Destiny|first=Anne Helen|last=Petersen|work=[[BuzzFeed News]]|date=7 February 2020|access-date=8 February 2020|archive-date=8 February 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200208144147/https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/annehelenpetersen/margot-robbie-birds-of-prey-harley-quinn-career-producer|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=http://www.goldcoast.com.au/article/2009/04/14/68845_gossip-news.html|title=Margot Robbie still girl next door| last= Miller| first= Katie| date=14 April 2009|work=Gold Coast|location=Australia|access-date=6 March 2010 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090925123847/http://www.goldcoast.com.au/article/2009/04/14/68845_gossip-news.html|archive-date=25 September 2009}} After graduation, with a few commercials and independent thriller films on her résumé, Robbie relocated to [[Melbourne]] to begin acting professionally.{{cite news|url=http://beta.abc.go.com/shows/pan-am/bios/laura-cameron|title=Laura Cameron Bio| publisher=[[American Broadcasting Company]]|access-date=27 September 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110926094315/http://beta.abc.go.com/shows/pan-am/bios/laura-cameron|archive-date=26 September 2011}}
{{cite web|title=Margot Robbie Interview|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-GYCckYh5G8|work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|access-date=7 January 2018|archive-date=24 September 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160924121618/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-GYCckYh5G8&gl=US&hl=en|url-status=live}} ==Career== ===2008–2012: Early work and ''Neighbours''=== [[File:Margot Robbie (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Robbie at the [[Logie Awards of 2011|2011 Logie Awards]]]] Robbie's first acting roles came when she was in high school. She starred in two low-budget independent thriller films, called ''Vigilante'' and ''[[I.C.U. (film)|I.C.U.]]'', both released years later. She described the experience of being on a [[Set (film and TV scenery)|film set]] as "a dream come true".{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98TyMVrh8sQ| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211028/98TyMVrh8sQ| archive-date=28 October 2021|title=Conversations with Margot Robbie of I, Tonya|work=[[SAG-AFTRA Foundation]]|date=12 January 2018|accessdate=19 April 2021}}{{cbignore}} She made her television debut in a 2008 guest role as Caitlin Brentford in the drama series ''[[City Homicide]]'' and followed this with a two-episode arc in the children's television series ''[[The Elephant Princess]]'', in which she starred alongside [[Liam Hemsworth]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/07/margot-robbie-cover-story|title=Welcome to the Summer of Margot Robbie|work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|first=Rich|last=Cohen|date=6 July 2016|accessdate=19 April 2021|archive-date=23 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210423023723/https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/07/margot-robbie-cover-story|url-status=live}} With agent encouragement at the time and as Robbie recalled on ''[[The Graham Norton Show]]'', she called [[FremantleMedia]] on a daily basis. "One day, I got put through by accident to the casting director for Neighbours," and she said, "I'm in town working on something." The casting director asked how old she was, and she responded "seventeen." She was told, "We're looking for exactly that, come in and audition"{{Cite web |title= The Graham Norton Show, Series 30, Episode 13 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m001h0zx |access-date=2023-01-17 |website=BBC One|language=en-GB |archive-date=14 January 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230114015222/http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/m001h0zx |url-status=live }} for the television soap opera ''[[Neighbours]]''. In June 2008, she began playing [[Donna Freedman]], a role that was meant to be a guest character, but Robbie was promoted to the regular cast after she made her debut.{{cite web|url=http://holysoap.five.tv/neighbours/cast/donna-freedman-215|title=Donna Freedman|work=[[Holy Soap]]|publisher=[[Channel 5 (UK)|Channel 5]]|access-date=27 September 2010|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090630012322/http://holysoap.five.tv/neighbours/cast/donna-freedman-215|archive-date=30 June 2009}} In her three-year stint on the soap, she received two [[Logie Award]] nominations.{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/news/a151251/smith-ritchie-score-gold-logie-nominations.html#~pa4uxPaywIfNe3|title=Smith, Ritchie score Gold Logie nominations|last=Rowe|first=Darren|date=30 March 2009|work=[[Digital Spy]]|access-date=17 April 2015|archive-date=18 January 2011|archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/5vq3obbnI?url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/news/a151251/smith-ritchie-score-gold-logie-nominations.html#~pa4uxPaywIfNe3|url-status=live}}
{{Cite news|url=http://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/a/-/breaking/9126477/marais-gibney-to-compete-for-gold-logie/|title=Marais, Gibney to compete for Gold Logie|last=Yeap|first=Sue|date=3 April 2011|work=[[The West Australian]]|access-date=6 April 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110405011315/http://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/a/-/breaking/9126477/marais-gibney-to-compete-for-gold-logie/|archive-date=5 April 2011|url-status=dead}} Shortly after arriving in America, Robbie landed the role of Laura Cameron, a newly trained flight attendant in the period drama series ''[[Pan Am (TV series)|Pan Am]]'' (2011). The series premiered to high ratings and positive reviews but was cancelled after one season due to falling ratings.{{cite web|url=https://www.deadline.com/2011/02/law-order-criminal-intent-gets-new-captain-pan-am-gets-first-stewardess/|title='Law & Order: Criminal Intent' Gets New Captain, 'Pan Am' Gets First Stewardess|first=Nellie|last=Andreeva|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|publisher=[[Mail.com Media]]|date=10 February 2011|access-date=12 February 2011|archive-date=13 February 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110213022744/http://www.deadline.com/2011/02/law-order-criminal-intent-gets-new-captain-pan-am-gets-first-stewardess/|url-status=live}}{{cite news|url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/ipad/margot-robbie-still-on-high-despite-shows-axing/story-fn6bn80a-1226367396218|title=Margot Robbie still on high despite show's axing|last=Bryne|first=Fiona|date=26 May 2012|work=[[Herald Sun]]|access-date=2 June 2012|archive-date=31 May 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140531081326/http://www.heraldsun.com.au/ipad/margot-robbie-still-on-high-despite-shows-axing/story-fn6bn80a-1226367396218|url-status=live}} ===2013–2015: Breakthrough=== Robbie next appeared in [[Richard Curtis]]' romantic comedy ''[[About Time (2013 film)|About Time]]'' (2013), co-starring [[Domhnall Gleeson]] and [[Rachel McAdams]]. It tells the story of a young man with the ability to time travel who tries to change his past in hopes of improving his future. To play Gleeson's unattainable teenage love interest, she adopted a British accent.{{cite web|url=https://moviehole.net/margot-robbies-rising-star/|title=Margot Robbie's Rising Star|work=Moviehole|first=Ashleigh|last=Davies|date=13 May 2016|accessdate=19 April 2021|archive-date=19 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210419225611/https://moviehole.net/margot-robbies-rising-star/|url-status=live}} The film was a modest commercial success.{{cite web|url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=abouttime.htm|title=About Time (2013)|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]]|accessdate=19 April 2021|archive-date=3 March 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303235524/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=abouttime.htm|url-status=live}} Robbie's breakthrough came the same year with the role of [[Naomi Lapaglia]], the wife of protagonist [[Jordan Belfort]], in [[Martin Scorsese]]'s biographical black comedy ''[[The Wolf of Wall Street (2013 film)|The Wolf of Wall Street]]''. In her audition for the role, Robbie improvised a slap on co-star [[Leonardo DiCaprio]] during a fight scene which ultimately won her the part.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a22213/margot-robbie-gave-leonardo-dicaprio-a-thunderclap-of-a-slap-in-wolf-of-wall-street-audition/|title=Why Margot Robbie Slapped Leonardo DiCaprio During Her 'Wolf of Wall Street' Audition|magazine=[[Harper's Bazaar]]|first=Zara|last=Kenyon|date=23 April 2017|accessdate=20 April 2021|archive-date=19 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210419224119/https://www.harpersbazaar.com/celebrity/latest/a22213/margot-robbie-gave-leonardo-dicaprio-a-thunderclap-of-a-slap-in-wolf-of-wall-street-audition/|url-status=live}} The film and her performance received positive reviews; she was particularly praised for her on-screen [[New York City English|Brooklyn accent]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2014/07/best-new-york-accents-movies|title=The Best, and Worst, New York Accents on Film|last=Liebman|first=Lisa|work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|date=2 July 2014|access-date=4 July 2015|archive-date=13 July 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150713073826/http://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2014/07/best-new-york-accents-movies|url-status=live}} Critic [[Sasha Stone (blogger)|Sasha Stone]] wrote of Robbie's performance, "She's Scorsese's best blonde bombshell discovery since [[Cathy Moriarty]] in ''[[Raging Bull]]''. Robbie is funny, hard and kills every scene she's in."{{cite news|url=http://www.awardsdaily.com/blog/2013/12/the-big-bad-wolf-wall-street-review/|title=The Big Bad Wolf of Wall Street-Review|last=Stone|first=Sasha|date=17 December 2013|work=Awards Daily|access-date=20 March 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150705174510/http://www.awardsdaily.com/blog/2013/12/the-big-bad-wolf-wall-street-review/|archive-date=5 July 2015|url-status=dead}} ''The Wolf of Wall Street'' was a box office success, grossing $392 million worldwide, making it Scorsese's highest-grossing film to date.{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/wolf-wall-street-is-martin-679314|title=Box-Office Milestone: 'Wolf of Wall Street' Becomes Martin Scorsese's Top-Grossing Film|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|access-date=3 August 2016|archive-date=24 January 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150124070717/http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/wolf-wall-street-is-martin-679314|url-status=live}} Robbie was nominated for the [[MTV Movie Award for Best Breakthrough Performance]] and won the [[Empire Award for Best Newcomer]].{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a555888/american-hustle-wolf-of-wall-street-lead-mtv-movie-awards-nominations.html|title=American Hustle, Wolf of Wall Street lead MTV Movie Awards nominations|last=Eames|first=Tom|date=6 March 2014|publisher=[[Digital Spy]]|access-date=6 March 2014|archive-date=6 March 2014|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140306181031/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a555888/american-hustle-wolf-of-wall-street-lead-mtv-movie-awards-nominations.html|url-status=live}}
{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/26816179/gravity-and-the-hobbit-among-2014-empire-winners|title=Gravity and The Hobbit among 2014 Empire winners|date=31 March 2014|publisher=[[Newsbeat]]|access-date=1 September 2019|archive-date=1 September 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190901003743/http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/26816179/gravity-and-the-hobbit-among-2014-empire-winners|url-status=live}} [[File:Margot Robbie by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Robbie at the 2015 [[San Diego Comic-Con]]]] She later said that the fame and attention the movie brought her led her to consider quitting acting, but her mother was philosophical about her profession and explained to her that it was probably too late to quit. She fully understood and stuck with it. With the aim to produce more female-driven projects, Robbie and her future husband, Tom Ackerley, and their respective longtime friends Sophia Kerr and Josey McNamara, started their own production company [[LuckyChap Entertainment]]. The company was founded in 2014 and its name was inspired by [[Charlie Chaplin]]. Robbie appeared in four films released in 2015. The first of these was opposite [[Will Smith]] in [[Glenn Ficarra]] and [[John Requa]]'s $158.8 million-grossing romantic comedy-drama film ''[[Focus (2015 film)|Focus]]''. In the film, she played an inexperienced [[Confidence trick|grifter]] learning the craft from Smith's character; she learned how to [[Pickpocketing|pickpocket]] from [[Apollo Robbins]] for the role.{{cite web|url=https://variety.com/2013/film/news/wolf-of-wall-street-actress-margot-robbie-lands-female-lead-opposite-will-smith-in-focus-exclusive-1200562319/|title='Wolf of Wall Street' Actress Margot Robbie Lands Female Lead Opposite Will Smith in 'Focus' (Exclusive)|last=Kroll|first=Justin|date=15 July 2013|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|access-date=16 July 2013|archive-date=18 July 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130718104900/http://variety.com/2013/film/news/wolf-of-wall-street-actress-margot-robbie-lands-female-lead-opposite-will-smith-in-focus-exclusive-1200562319/|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=https://www.thewrap.com/margot-robbie-will-smith-on-how-they-learned-to-con-in-bonus-focus-clip-video/|title=Margot Robbie, Will Smith on How They Learned to Con in Bonus 'Focus' Clip (Video)|work=[[TheWrap]]|first=Beatrice|last=Verhoeven|date=3 June 2015|access-date=20 April 2021|archive-date=20 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210420225753/https://www.thewrap.com/margot-robbie-will-smith-on-how-they-learned-to-con-in-bonus-focus-clip-video/|url-status=live}} Reviews of the film were generally mixed, but Robbie's performance was praised; [[Peter Travers]] of ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' wrote, "Robbie is wow and then some. Even when ''Focus'' fumbles, [she] deals a winning hand."{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/focus_2014/|title=Focus|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|access-date=16 March 2015|archive-date=15 March 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150315075225/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/focus_2014|url-status=live}}
{{cite magazine |url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/focus-20150226 |title=Focus |last=Travers |first=Peter |magazine=Rolling Stone |date=26 February 2015 |access-date=22 March 2015 |archive-date=26 March 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150326001303/http://www.rollingstone.com/movies/reviews/focus-20150226 |url-status=live }}
{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=focus2015.htm|title=Focus (2015)|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]]|access-date=22 April 2015|archive-date=19 April 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150419122220/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=focus2015.htm|url-status=live}} She was nominated for the [[BAFTA Rising Star Award|Rising Star Award]] at the [[68th British Academy Film Awards]].{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/news/baftas-2015-jack-oconnell-margot-robbie-and-shailene-woodley-among-rising-star-nominees-9962180.html|title=BAFTAs 2015: Jack O'Connell, Margot Robbie and Shailene Woodley among rising star nominees|last=Denham|first=Jess|date=7 January 2015|work=[[The Independent]]|access-date=7 January 2015|archive-date=11 February 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150211030434/http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/news/baftas-2015-jack-oconnell-margot-robbie-and-shailene-woodley-among-rising-star-nominees-9962180.html|url-status=live}} Her next appearance was alongside [[Michelle Williams (actress)|Michelle Williams]] and [[Kristin Scott Thomas]] in [[Saul Dibb]]'s war romantic drama ''[[Suite Française (film)|Suite Française]]'', a film based on the second part of [[Irène Némirovsky]]'s 2004 [[Suite française (Némirovsky)|novel of the same name]]. In the film, she played a woman falling for a German soldier during the [[German occupation of France during World War II]], a role which Leslie Felperin of ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' found "underwritten".{{cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/review/suite-francaise-film-review-780148|title='Suite Francaise': Film Review|work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|first=Leslie|last=Felperin|date=10 March 2015|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=19 June 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220619141833/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-reviews/suite-francaise-film-review-780148/|url-status=live}} She followed this with [[Craig Zobel]]'s post-apocalyptic drama ''[[Z for Zachariah (film)|Z for Zachariah]]'' opposite [[Chris Pine]] and [[Chiwetel Ejiofor]], in her first leading role. Partially based on [[Robert C. O'Brien (author)|Robert C. O'Brien]]'s [[Z for Zachariah|book of the same name]], the film follows Ann Burden (Robbie) as she finds herself in an emotionally charged love triangle with the last known survivors of a disaster that wipes out most of civilization. In preparation for the film, Robbie dyed her hair brown and learned to speak in an [[Appalachian Americans|Appalachian]] accent.{{cite web|url=https://www.vogue.com/article/margot-robbie-z-for-zachariah|title=Margot Robbie on Z for Zachariah, Suicide Squad, and Adjusting to Celebrity|work=[[Vogue (magazine)|Vogue]]|first=Jessie|last=Heyman|date=28 August 2015|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=20 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210420225809/https://www.vogue.com/article/margot-robbie-z-for-zachariah|url-status=live}} The film received positive reviews, and Robbie's performance was widely praised, with Drew McWeeny of [[HitFix]] asserting that "Robbie's work here establishes her as one of the very best actresses in her age range today."{{cite news|url=http://www.hitfix.com/motion-captured/review-margot-robbie-shines-in-subtle-end-of-the-world-film-z-for-zachariah|title=Margot Robbie shines in subtle end-of-world film 'Z for Zachariah'|last=McWeeny|first=Drew|date=25 January 2015|publisher=HitFix|access-date=20 March 2015|archive-date=22 March 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160322041724/http://www.hitfix.com/motion-captured/review-margot-robbie-shines-in-subtle-end-of-the-world-film-z-for-zachariah|url-status=live}}{{cite web |url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/z_for_zachariah/ |title=Z for Zachariah (2015) |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |access-date=27 August 2015 |archive-date=26 August 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150826060433/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/z_for_zachariah/ |url-status=live }} Her fourth release of 2015 was a [[cameo appearance]] in [[Adam McKay]]'s comedy-drama ''[[The Big Short (film)|The Big Short]]'', in which she breaks the [[fourth wall]] to explain [[Subprime lending|subprime mortgages]] while in a bathtub. ''The Big Short'' was a commercial and critical success and Robbie's cameo became a [[Twitter trends|trending topic]] six years later, in the wake of the [[GameStop short squeeze]], as her explanation provided reference points for what was happening with the GameStop and related stocks.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_big_short/|title=The Big Short (2015)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango (company)|Fandango Media]]|access-date=21 April 2021|archive-date=20 January 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160120165025/http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_big_short/|url-status=live}}
{{cite web |url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=bigshort.htm |title=The Big Short (2015) – Box Office Mojo |website=Box Office Mojo |access-date=21 April 2021 |archive-date=30 January 2016 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160130175347/http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=bigshort.htm |url-status=live }}
{{cite web|url=https://www.instyle.com/news/gamestop-stock-options-explainer-margot-robbie|title=What AOC and Margot Robbie Have to Do with GameStop|work=[[InStyle]]|first=Sam|last=Reed|date=28 January 2021|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=21 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210421101552/https://www.instyle.com/news/gamestop-stock-options-explainer-margot-robbie|url-status=live}} ===2016–2018: Worldwide recognition=== In 2016, Robbie reunited with Ficarra and Requa, playing a British [[war correspondent]] in the film adaptation of ''[[The Taliban Shuffle]]'', called ''[[Whiskey Tango Foxtrot (film)|Whiskey Tango Foxtrot]]'', co-starring [[Tina Fey]] and [[Martin Freeman]].{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/whiskey_tango_foxtrot/|title=Whiskey Tango Foxtrot (2016)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|access-date=7 May 2020|archive-date=28 November 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171128103524/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/whiskey_tango_foxtrot/|url-status=live}}{{cite web |url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=untitledtinafeycomedy.htm |title=Whiskey Tango Foxtrot (2016) |website=Box Office Mojo |access-date=21 April 2021 |archive-date=21 January 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190121020936/https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=untitledtinafeycomedy.htm |url-status=live }} Later that year, Robbie took on the part of [[Jane Porter (Tarzan)|Jane Porter]] in [[David Yates]]'s adventure film ''[[The Legend of Tarzan (film)|The Legend of Tarzan]]''. She was adamant about not losing weight and ensuring the role was not a [[damsel in distress]] like in previous [[Tarzan]] adaptations.{{cite web|url=https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/margot-robbie-making-tarzan-character-damsel-distress/story?id=40220553|title=Margot Robbie on Not Making Her 'Tarzan' Character a 'Damsel in Distress'|work=[[ABC News]]|date=1 July 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=21 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210421125559/https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/margot-robbie-making-tarzan-character-damsel-distress/story?id=40220553|url-status=live}} Reviews of the film were generally unfavourable,{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_legend_of_tarzan/|title=The Legend of Tarzan (2016)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|access-date=21 April 2021|archive-date=29 June 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160629225525/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/the_legend_of_tarzan/|url-status=live}} but [[Manohla Dargis]] of ''[[The New York Times]]'' credited Robbie for "holding her own" in her supporting role alongside the all-male cast with [[Alexander Skarsgård]] and [[Samuel L. Jackson]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/01/movies/the-legend-of-tarzan-review.html|title=Review: A 'Tarzan' With a Few Twists in the Hollywood Vine|last=Dargis|first=Manohla|author-link1=Manohla Dargis|date=30 June 2016|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]|url-access=limited|issn=0362-4331|access-date=8 July 2016|archive-date=8 July 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160708172341/http://www.nytimes.com/2016/07/01/movies/the-legend-of-tarzan-review.html|url-status=live}} Robbie became the first person to portray [[DC Comics]] villain [[Harley Quinn]] in [[Live action|live-action]] when she signed on to [[David Ayer]]'s 2016 superhero film ''[[Suicide Squad (2016 film)|Suicide Squad]]'' alongside an [[ensemble cast]] that included Will Smith, [[Jared Leto]] and [[Viola Davis]]. She admitted to having never read the comics, but felt a huge responsibility to do the character justice and satisfy the fans.{{cite web|url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/movies/ct-margot-robbie-on-becoming-harley-quinn-suicide-squad-20160804-story.html|title=Margot Robbie on becoming Harley Quinn and 'the most unpleasant thing I've ever done'|work=[[Chicago Tribune]]|first=David|last=Betancourt|date=4 August 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=21 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210421131101/https://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/movies/ct-margot-robbie-on-becoming-harley-quinn-suicide-squad-20160804-story.html|url-status=live}} Robbie began preparing for the role of the [[supervillainess]] six months prior to the film shoot; her schedule consisted of [[gymnastics]], [[boxing]], [[aerial silk]] training and learning how to hold her breath underwater for five minutes. She performed the majority of her own stunts in the film.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FHNNp2zwLtc| archive-url=https://ghostarchive.org/varchive/youtube/20211028/FHNNp2zwLtc| archive-date=28 October 2021|title=Workout 'Suicide Squad' Behind The Scenes [+Subtitles]|work=[[YouTube]]|accessdate=21 April 2021}}{{cbignore}} ''Suicide Squad'' was a commercial success and was [[2016 in film#Highest-grossing films|tenth-highest-grossing film of 2016]] with global revenues of $746.8 million, and Robbie's performance was considered its prime asset.{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/movie-news/why-harley-quinn-is-the-best-and-worst-thing-about-suicide-squad-248939/|title=Why Harley Quinn Is the Best (and Worst) Thing About 'Suicide Squad'|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|first=David|last=Fear|date=5 August 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=23 July 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200723055900/https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/movie-news/why-harley-quinn-is-the-best-and-worst-thing-about-suicide-squad-248939/|url-status=live}} Writing for ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'', [[Stephanie Zacharek]] found Robbie to be "a criminally appealing actress, likable in just about every way" despite finding flaws in the character{{cite magazine|url=https://time.com/4430396/suicide-squad-review/|title=Review: Loaded with Jokes But Devoid of Wit, Suicide Squad Is Dead on Arrival|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|first=Stephanie|last=Zacharek|date=2 August 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=23 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210423055839/https://time.com/4430396/suicide-squad-review/|url-status=live}} and [[Christopher Orr (film critic)|Christopher Orr]] of ''[[The Atlantic]]'' called her performance "genuinely terrific".{{cite web|url=https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2016/08/suicide-squad-review/494669/|title=Suicide Squad Is the Worst of the Worst|work=[[The Atlantic]]|first=Christopher|last=Orr|date=5 August 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=29 November 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201129212004/https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2016/08/suicide-squad-review/494669/|url-status=live}} At the annual [[People's Choice Awards]] ceremony, she won the [[43rd People's Choice Awards|Favorite Action Movie Actress]] award and was also awarded the [[Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Actress in an Action Movie]].{{cite web|title=People's Choice Awards 2017: Full List Of Winners|url=http://blog.peopleschoice.com/2017/01/18/peoples-choice-awards-2017-winners/|website=People's Choice|accessdate=19 January 2017|date=19 In October 2016, Robbie hosted the [[Saturday Night Live (season 42)|season 42]] premiere of [[NBC]]'s late-night sketch comedy ''[[Saturday Night Live]]''; her appearances included a parody of [[Ivanka Trump]].{{cite web|url=https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/10/margot-robbie-ivanka-trump-snl|title=Margot Robbie Does a Perfect Ivanka Trump on SNL's All-Star "Political Family Feud" Sketch|work=[[Vanity Fair (magazine)|Vanity Fair]]|first=Emma|last=Stefansky|date=2 October 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=13 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210513205634/https://www.vanityfair.com/hollywood/2016/10/margot-robbie-ivanka-trump-snl|url-status=live}} The series logged its strongest season premiere ratings in eight years.{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2016/10/saturday-night-live-season-premiere-ratings-donald-trump-alec-baldwin-1201829687/|title='Saturday Night Live' Draws 8.3 Million Viewers In Strongest Season Opener Since 2008 – Update|work=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|first=Nellie|last=Andreeva|date=4 October 2016|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=21 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210421205535/https://deadline.com/2016/10/saturday-night-live-season-premiere-ratings-donald-trump-alec-baldwin-1201829687/|url-status=live}} Robbie collaborated with Domhnall Gleeson in [[Simon Curtis (filmmaker)|Simon Curtis]]' ''[[Goodbye Christopher Robin]]'' (2017), a biographical drama about the lives of ''[[Winnie-the-Pooh]]'' creator [[A. A. Milne]] and his family. The film, and her performance, received modest reviews and was a commercial failure.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/goodbye_christopher_robin/|title=Goodbye Christopher Robin (2017)|work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|access-date=1 May 2020|archive-date=20 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200820122611/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/goodbye_christopher_robin|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|url=https://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Goodbye-Christopher-Robin#tab=summary|title=Goodbye Christopher Robin (2017)|website=[[The Numbers (website)|The Numbers]]|access-date=3 January 2018|archive-date=28 January 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180128190501/https://www.the-numbers.com/movie/Goodbye-Christopher-Robin#tab=summary|url-status=live}} [[File:Margot Robbie (28601016915) (cropped 3).jpg|thumb|upright|left|Robbie in 2016]] Her final release of 2017 and LuckyChap Entertainment's first release was [[Craig Gillespie]]'s sports black comedy ''[[I, Tonya]]'', based on the life of American figure skater [[Tonya Harding]] (Robbie) and her connection to the [[Assault of Nancy Kerrigan|1994 assault]] on rival [[Nancy Kerrigan]]. In preparation, Robbie met with Harding, watched old footage and interviews of her, worked with a voice coach to speak in Harding's [[Pacific Northwest English|Pacific Northwest]] accent and vocal timbre at different ages, and underwent several months of rigorous skating instruction with choreographer [[Sarah Kawahara]].{{cite magazine|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/movie-features/i-tonya-margot-robbie-on-becoming-tonya-harding-201826/|title='I, Tonya': Margot Robbie on Becoming Tonya Harding|magazine=[[Rolling Stone]]|first=Esther|last=Zuckerman|date=8 December 2017|accessdate=21 April 2021|archive-date=27 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210427211226/https://www.rollingstone.com/movies/movie-features/i-tonya-margot-robbie-on-becoming-tonya-harding-201826/|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=https://www.vulture.com/2017/12/how-margot-robbie-became-tonya-harding-in-i-tonya.html|title=How To Turn Margot Robbie Into Tonya Harding|work=[[New York (magazine)|Vulture]]|first=Ashley|last=Fetters|date=7 December 2017|accessdate=22 April 2021|archive-date=16 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210416004718/https://www.vulture.com/2017/12/how-margot-robbie-became-tonya-harding-in-i-tonya.html|url-status=live}} ''I, Tonya'' premiered at the [[2017 Toronto International Film Festival]] to critical acclaim.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/i_tonya|title=I, Tonya|publisher=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|access-date=8 March 2021|archive-date=5 May 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190505194031/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/i_tonya|url-status=live}} James Luxford of ''[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]]'' deemed it Robbie's best performance to date, and [[Mark Kermode]] of ''[[The Observer]]'' wrote, "Margot Robbie's performance in this satirical, postmodern tale of the disgraced star is a tour-de-force tornado that balances finely nuanced character development with impressively punchy physicality".{{cite web|url=https://metro.co.uk/2018/02/22/i-tonya-review-margot-robbies-disgraced-skater-is-her-best-performance-yet-7330715/|title=I, Tonya review: Margot Robbie's disgraced skater is her best 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210517130235/https://metro.co.uk/2018/02/22/i-tonya-review-margot-robbies-disgraced-skater-is-her-best-performance-yet-7330715/|url-status=live}}{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/feb/25/i-tonya-film-review-margot-robbie-sharp-satire|title=I, Tonya review – Margot Robbie doesn't put a foot wrong|work=The Observer|first=Mark|last=Kermode|date=25 February 2018|accessdate=22 April 2021|archive-date=21 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210821204154/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2018/feb/25/i-tonya-film-review-margot-robbie-sharp-satire|url-status=live}} She received numerous |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/bafta-2018-complete-list-nominations-1067881 |title=BAFTA Awards: 'Shape of Water,' 'Three Billboards,' 'Darkest Hour' Lead Pack of Nominations |first=Alex |last=Ritman |work=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |date=8 January 2018 |access-date=8 January 2018 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180109235303/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/lists/bafta-2018-complete-list-nominations-1067881 |archive-date=9 January 2018 }}
{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2017/film/news/golden-globe-nominations-2018-nominees-full-list-1202634435/|title=Golden Globe Nominations: Complete List|last=Rubin|first=Rebecca|date=11 December 2017|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|access-date=11 December 2017|archive-date=14 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171214021531/http://variety.com/2017/film/news/golden-globe-nominations-2018-nominees-full-list-1202634435/|url-status=live}}
{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/23/movies/oscar-nominations.html|title=2018 Oscar Nominations: 'The Shape of Water' Leads With 13 Nominations|last=Barnes|first=Brooks|date=23 January 2018|work=[[The New York Times]]|url-access=limited|access-date=23 January 2018|archive-date=2 February 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180202205746/https://www.nytimes.com/2018/01/23/movies/oscar-nominations.html|url-status=live}}
{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2017/12/critics-choice-awards-nominations-the-shape-of-water-dunkirk-this-is-us-netflix-1202220528/|title=Critics' Choice Awards Nominations: 'The Shape Of Water' Leads With 14 Nods; Netflix Tops TV Contenders|last1=Pedersen|first1=Erik|last2=Hammond|first2=Pete|date=6 December 2017|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|accessdate=6 December 2017|archive-date=6 December 2017|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171206225214/https://deadline.com/2017/12/critics-choice-awards-nominations-the-shape-of-water-dunkirk-this-is-us-netflix-1202220528/|url-status=live}} Robbie began 2018 with the voice role of [[Flopsy Rabbit]] in ''[[Peter Rabbit (film)|Peter Rabbit]]'', an animated comedy from director [[Will Gluck]], which is based on the [[Beatrix Potter]] [[Peter Rabbit|book series]]. The animated feature was a box office success, grossing $351.3 million worldwide against a production budget of $50 million.{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=peterrabbit.htm|title=''Peter Rabbit'' (2018)|publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]]|access-date=20 August 2018|archive-date=27 November 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181127022536/https://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=peterrabbit.htm|url-status=live}} Her next two 2018 films{{mdash}}the neo-noir thriller ''[[Terminal (film)|Terminal]]'' and comedy-horror ''[[Slaughterhouse Rulez]]''{{mdash}}were critical and commercial failures. The historical drama ''[[Mary Queen of Scots (2018 film)|Mary Queen of Scots]]'', directed by [[Josie Rourke]], was her final release of 2018. The film featured [[Saoirse Ronan]] as the [[Mary, Queen of Scots|titular character]] and Robbie as her cousin [[Queen Elizabeth I]], and it chronicles the [[Rising of the North|1569 conflict between their two countries]]. Robbie had initially turned down the role for being "terrified" of not living up to the history of portrayals of the Queen.{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/movies/2018/12/10/margot-robbie-mary-queen-of-scots-video/|title=Margot Robbie was 'terrified' to play Queen Elizabeth I in Mary Queen of Scots|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|first=Shirley|last=Li|date=10 December 2018|accessdate=22 April 2021|archive-date=22 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210422162900/https://ew.com/movies/2018/12/10/margot-robbie-mary-queen-of-scots-video/|url-status=live}} Before each day of shooting, she spent three hours in the make-up chair while a prosthetic nose, painted on boils and blisters were applied.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2019/jan/20/mary-queen-of-scots-review-saoirse-ronan-margot-robbie-josie-rourke|title=Oscar-nominated artist had 'terrific' time disfiguring Margot Robbie in Mary Queen of Scots|work=[[Evening Standard]]|first1=Robert|last1=Dex|date=25 January 2019|accessdate=22 April 2021|archive-date=22 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210422162900/https://www.theguardian.com/film/2019/jan/20/mary-queen-of-scots-review-saoirse-ronan-margot-robbie-josie-rourke|url-status=live}} Critics dismissed the film for its screenplay and several historical inaccuracies, but praised the performances of Robbie and Ronan.{{cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/mary_queen_of_scots|title=Mary Queen of Scots (2018)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|publisher=[[Fandango Media]]|access-date=10 May 2020|archive-date=23 January 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210123140829/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/mary_queen_of_scots|url-status=live}} Yolanda Machado of ''[[TheWrap]]'' wrote, "[B]ow down to Ronan and Robbie for taking two legendarily complex characters, [...] and completely owning both roles. Ronan's fiery Mary and Robbie's emotionally complex Elizabeth truly reign divine on screen."{{cite web|url=https://www.thewrap.com/mary-queen-of-scots-film-review-saoirse-ronan-margot-robbie/|title='Mary, Queen of Scots' Film Review: Saoirse Ronan and Margot Robbie Make Worthy, Regal Adversaries|work=TheWrap|first=Yolanda|last=Machado|date=5 December 2018|accessdate=22 April 2021|archive-date=22 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210422162902/https://www.thewrap.com/mary-queen-of-scots-film-review-saoirse-ronan-margot-robbie/|url-status=live}} For her portrayal, Robbie received nominations for a [[BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role|BAFTA Award]] and for a [[Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Supporting Role|Screen Actors Guild Award]].{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-46794243|title=Bafta Film Awards 2019: The winners and nominees in full|date=10 January 2019|publisher=[[BBC News]]|access-date=10 January 2019|archive-date=10 January 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190110073201/https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-46794243|url-status=live}}
{{cite news|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/2019-sag-award-nominations-list-nominees-1203087472/|title=SAG Award Nominations: Complete List|date=12 December 2018|work=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]|access-date=12 December 2018|archive-date=13 December 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181213012022/https://variety.com/2018/film/news/2019-sag-award-nominations-list-nominees-1203087472/|url-status=live}} ===2019–present: Established actress and producer=== [[File:Margot Robbie 2019 by Glenn Francis (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Robbie at the premiere of ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]'' in 2019]] Robbie's first release of 2019 was the LuckyChap Entertainment production ''[[Dreamland (2019 American film)|Dreamland]]'', a poorly received period crime thriller set during the 1930s [[Dust Bowl]].{{cite web|url=https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl2271183617/weekend/|title=Dreamland|website=[[Box Office Mojo]]|access-date=31 March 2021|archive-date=21 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210221042646/https://www.boxofficemojo.com/release/rl2271183617/weekend/|url-status=live}}
{{Cite web|url=https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/dreamland_2019|title=Dreamland (2019)|website=[[Rotten Tomatoes]]|access-date=20 February 2021|archive-date=17 November 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201117191429/https://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/dreamland_2019|url-status=live}} She began executive producing the comedy series ''[[Dollface]]'', which streamed on [[Hulu]] from 2019 to 2022.{{cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/dollface-team-talks-friendship-love-stories-getting-women-behind-camera-1238837|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=16 November 2019|accessdate=13 August 2020|title='Dollface' Team Talks "Friendship Love Stories," Getting Women Behind the Camera|last=Chuba|first=Kirsten|archive-date=15 August 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200815074629/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/dollface-team-talks-friendship-love-stories-getting-women-behind-camera-1238837|url-status=live}} Robbie was filmmaker [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s only choice to portray the late actress [[Sharon Tate]] in his period film ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]'', starring Leonardo DiCaprio and [[Brad Pitt]].{{cite magazine|url=https://ew.com/movies/2019/07/22/margot-robbie-quentin-tarantino-once-upon-a-time-in-hollywood/|title=Quentin Tarantino says Margot Robbie was his first and only choice to play Sharon Tate|magazine=[[Entertainment Weekly]]|first=Clark|last=Collis|date=22 July 2021|accessdate=23 April 2021|archive-date=27 June 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210627233240/https://ew.com/movies/2019/07/22/margot-robbie-quentin-tarantino-once-upon-a-time-in-hollywood/|url-status=live}} With the [[Tate–LaBianca murders]] serving as a backdrop, the film tells the story of a fading [[Rick Dalton|character actor]] (DiCaprio) and his [[stunt double]] (Pitt) as they navigate [[New Hollywood]] in 1969 Los Angeles.{{cite news |title=Once Upon a Time In... Hollywood Movie Synopsis |url=https://www.onceuponatimeinhollywood.movie/synopsis/ |access-date=22 March 2019 |publisher=[[Sony Pictures Releasing]] |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190322054919/https://www.onceuponatimeinhollywood.movie/synopsis/ |archive-date=22 March 2019 }}
{{cite web|url=https://www.rte.ie/entertainment/2019/0812/1068319-tarantino-couldnt-believe-kismet-of-casting-robbie/|title=Exclusive Quentin Tarantino couldn't believe 'kismet' of casting Margot Robbie|work=[[Raidió Teilifís Éireann]]|date=12 August 2019|accessdate=22 April 2021|archive-date=22 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210422225338/https://www.rte.ie/entertainment/2019/0812/1068319-tarantino-couldnt-believe-kismet-of-casting-robbie/|url-status=live}} Feeling "an enormous sense of responsibility", Robbie prepared for the role by meeting Tate's family members and friends, watching all of her films and reading the autobiography by Tate's then-husband, [[Roman Polanski]].{{cite news|url=https://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/film/102348149/margot-robbie-confirms-she-will-play-sharon-tate-in-quentin-tarantino-movie|title=Margot Robbie confirms she will play Sharon Tate in Quentin Tarantino movie|last=McDonald|first=Dani|work=[[Stuff.co.nz]]|date=16 March 2018|access-date=16 March 2018|archive-date=17 March 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180317105636/https://www.stuff.co.nz/entertainment/film/102348149/margot-robbie-confirms-she-will-play-sharon-tate-in-quentin-tarantino-movie|url-status=live}}
{{Cite news|last=Sharf|first=Zack|title=Margot Robbie Didn't Consult Roman Polanski for Her Portrayal of Sharon Tate|publisher=[[IndieWire]]|date=3 December 2018|access-date=6 January 2019|url=https://www.indiewire.com/2018/12/margot-robbie-sharon-tate-prep-once-upon-a-time-in-hollywood-tarantino-1202024791/|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181205193423/https://www.indiewire.com/2018/12/margot-robbie-sharon-tate-prep-once-upon-a-time-in-hollywood-tarantino-1202024791/|archive-date=5 December 2018|url-status=live}}

{{cite web|url=https://in.mashable.com/entertainment/10081/bombshell-review-charlize-theron-nicole-kidman-margot-robbie-shine-through-the-dull-storytelling|title=Bombshell Review: Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie Shine Through The Dull Storytelling|work=[[Mashable]]|first=Pramit|last=Chatterjee|date=3 January 2020|accessdate=23 April 2021|archive-date=23 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210423170509/https://in.mashable.com/entertainment/10081/bombshell-review-charlize-theron-nicole-kidman-margot-robbie-shine-through-the-dull-storytelling|url-status=live}} [[Kenneth Turan]] of the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]'' wrote, "Robbie [is] at her best, the arc of her story is so crushing that it stays with you the longest."{{cite web|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/movies/story/2019-12-12/bombshell-review-fox-news|title=Review: Based on the real-life drama at Fox News, 'Bombshell' explodes on the screen|work=Los Angeles Times|first=Kenneth|last=Turan|date=12 December 2020|accessdate=23 April 2021|archive-date=23 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210423170506/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/movies/story/2019-12-12/bombshell-review-fox-news|url-status=live}} For her performances in ''Once Upon a Time in Hollywood'' and ''Bombshell'', she received two nominations for the [[BAFTA Award for Best Actress in a Supporting Role]], and for the latter she received nominations for an [[Academy Award]], a [[Golden Globe]] and a Screen Actors Guild Award;
